main event: A red light with flashes of white, green and blue was observed in the sky over Middletown, Ohio on August 6 and 22, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed through a telescope and appeared to be in orbit around the Earth.
The object was initially thought to possibly be an aircraft or balloon, but was later concluded to be an unknown, possibly astronomical, object.
The object was observed to move at a very high speed, estimated to be between 13,000-15,000 mph.
The object was estimated to be 13,000-15,000 miles away from the observer.
The object exhibited unusual maneuvers, such as appearing to stand still, suddenly speeding up, and changing direction.
sighted object: a red light with flashes of white, green and blue
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
